Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class CSVUtil<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.CSVUtil<X>
Type Parameters:
X - the type of objects to be serialised, must implement Writeable interface
public class CSVUtil<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable> extends Object
Utility class for converting objects to CSV format.

This class provides functionality to transform objects annotated with JsonProperty into CSV rows with appropriate escaping for CSV special characters. The transformation follows the standard CSV format specification where fields may be quoted if they contain commas, quotes, or newlines.

Each property value is sanitised according to the following rules:

  • Null values are represented as "NA"
  • Strings containing commas, quotes, or newlines are quoted
  • Quotes within strings are escaped by doubling them
Author:
Rob Challen

  • Constructor Details

    • CSVUtil

      public CSVUtil(Class<X> clazz)
      Constructs a new CSVUtil instance for the specified class.

      The constructor initialises the utility by scanning all methods annotated with JsonProperty in the provided class. These methods are used to extract property values during CSV serialisation.

      Parameters:
      clazz - the class type parameterised by X that implements Writeable
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if clazz is null

  • Method Details

    • csvFrom

      public static String csvFrom(Object... objects)
      Generates a CSV-formatted string from an array of objects.

      This static method converts individual values to CSV format and concatenates them with comma separators.

      Parameters:
      objects - the objects to convert to CSV format
      Returns:
      a CSV-formatted string of the input objects

    • fieldsStream

      public Stream<Object> fieldsStream(X tmp)
      Creates a stream of field values from the specified object.

      This method provides access to the property values as a stream, allowing for further stream processing operations. The stream is constructed from the array of values obtained by invoking annotated methods on the object instance.

      Parameters:
      tmp - the object instance to extract field values from
      Returns:
      a stream containing property values in declared order

    • headers

      public String headers()
      Generates the CSV header row containing property names.

      The header row is composed of the JsonProperty annotation values extracted from all annotated methods in the class.

      Returns:
      the CSV header row as a comma-separated string

    • row

      public String row(X value)
      Generates a CSV row from the specified object instance.

      This method extracts property values from the object and converts them to CSV format.

      Parameters:
      value - the object instance to serialise as a CSV row
      Returns:
      the object's data formatted as a CSV row
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if property access fails during reflection

    • valuesOf

      public Object[] valuesOf(X single)
      Extracts property values from an object instance via reflection.

      This method invokes all methods annotated with JsonProperty on the specified object to obtain the corresponding property values. The values are returned in the same order as the methods array.

      Parameters:
      single - the object instance to extract values from
      Returns:
      an array of property values in declaration order
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if reflection invocation fails
